Reorder mlx array axes

mlx_moveaxis.Rd

  • mlx_moveaxis() repositions one or more axes to new locations.

  • aperm.mlx() provides the familiar R interface, permuting axes according to perm via repeated calls to mlx_moveaxis().

Usage

mlx_moveaxis(x, source, destination)

# S3 method for class 'mlx'
aperm(a, perm = NULL, resize = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

x, a

An object coercible to mlx via as_mlx().

source

Integer vector of axis indices to move (1-indexed; negatives count from the end).

destination

Integer vector giving the target positions for source axes (1-indexed; negatives count from the end). Must be the same length as source.

perm

Integer permutation describing the desired axis order, matching the semantics of base::aperm().

resize

Logical flag from base::aperm(). Only TRUE is currently supported for mlx arrays.

...

Additional arguments accepted for compatibility; ignored.

Value

An mlx array with axes permuted.

See also

https://ml-explore.github.io/mlx/build/html/python/array.html#mlx.core.moveaxis

Examples

x <- as_mlx(array(1:8, dim = c(2, 2, 2)))
moved <- mlx_moveaxis(x, source = 1, destination = 3)
permuted <- aperm(x, c(2, 1, 3))
